title: As a GP main, I'm actually pleading with you: Get rid of Kleptomancy (Polite and Constructive)
body:
Or completely revamp it. GP was a very balanced champion with a respectable and balanced win rate. He was clearly balanced in every way and had very, VERY clear weaknesses before Kleptomancy. He is now at nearly a 20% ban rate because of one rune and the only thing that has changed about him was the rune itself. 

As an ADC, Ezreal was unquestionably the worst in the game. This is why people started taking him as a jungler. Kleptomancy comes and all of a sudden he is pick or ban with a win rate in a range of 53-56%. 

Please Riot, do not nerf GP just because he can make good use of this rune. I've had a day or two to articulate this and I now know that Klepto either needs to be taken out of the game or changed heavily so that it works on champions outside of those that abuse on hit effects. 

Without this rune, GP is balanced and Ezreal is still weak.

Since I only really play Nasus I'll speak for him in particular. Although I did get a Kleptomancy Ezreal game earlier and good god I had to shower after because I felt *dirty*.

Nasus really doesn't make use of Kleptomancy except as a "win more" rune, but damn it's effective when it works. His Siphoning Strike isn't up enough for it to be consistently procced early game, where it really matters a heap.
Because of its cooldown and how comparatively rubbish he is in early trades, he's not got too much incentive to consistently dump effort into getting a klepto proc. Most times it's used it was incidental, I find.
Once he starts aggressing, though, then he starts properly raking it in. You know how it is, when after he's gotten over his early hump and he's actually a lot more willing to trade hits. And that, on top of the fact you can't bully him away from the farm now, *on top of* the occasional kill he gets... Whew.

What is *really* exacerbating his win rate right now though is the Ancient Coin start that's popular. We can all agree that he's pretty pants until he gets a component item or two but after that small step, good lord.
It's super super hard to choke him out of money with that.
Because of pretty much the coin alone in one game (and first tower gold from bot), I was down 30CS, and a kill vs a Darius.
But I was 150g **ahead**. He'd played everything super well up to that point, but because Coin was in my pocket (actually upgraded to Nomad's at that point), I was *ahead*. I was super surprised when I looked through the replay.

That should resolve itself some with the changes to support items, I know a bunch of folks are more apprehensive about the sightstone being given to them than the super strong Talisman.
But I'm just as excited for the nearly-free sightstone. More vision? Yes please!
